post_text: Here’s a fun way to keep your whole family smiling this summer: create a Kindness Wall in your house! Draw some large hearts on pieces of construction paper, and ask your child to help cut them out. Place the hearts, along with some crayons or markers, in a central place in your house. When one family member notices someone else doing something kind, draw or write them a kindness heart, to be hung somewhere the whole family can see. Check out how this effort created a positive culture at Webster Elementary, and then try it yourself at home! http://www.syracusecityschools.com/districtpage.cfm?pageid=11130 #SCSDSummerLearning

Syracuse City School District to Close in Observance of Juneteenth

In accordance with Governor Cuomo’s Executive Order marking Juneteenth as a holiday for state workers the Syracuse City School District will be closed on Friday, June 19th, 2020.

Juneteenth is the commemoration of the end of slavery in the United States. The origins of the commemoration date back to June 19th, 1865, when enslaved African Americans in Galveston, Texas first heard that the Civil War had ended, and they were free. Juneteenth gets its name from a combination of June and nineteenth and is also known as Black Independence Day, Juneteenth Independence Day, and Emancipation Day.

The meal pick-up sites will remain open for distribution but all other district schools and offices will be closed to the public.

post_text: What an awesome opportunity for Franklin Elementary #SCSDArts students! Art teacher Kristen Raymond asked the owners at Glazed and Confused if her students could participate in their coloring contest by submitting entries digitally, and the shop agreed. Thirty students submitted entries via Seesaw, and the shop donated enough donuts for students who participated to pick them up at school in a social-distancing safe drive through. Seventeen families showed up to claim their donuts, including first grader Gia, pictured here. #SCSDGivesThanks to the community groups that have provided ways for our students to stay engaged during these unique times, and to our staff who go above and beyond to encourage their students to keep actively learning and developing their skills!

In celebration of NASW NYS Chapter Social Work Month, Syracuse STEM at Blodgett Middle School Principal Harry Valentin wanted to show extra appreciation for social worker Shantanette Patrice-Johnson.

“Mrs. Patrice-Johnson defines through her work the meaning of true leadership,” Dr. Valentin said. “She is an advocate for each one of our students. She has a huge sense of the importance of building community through a culturally responsive education in order to provide the best school environment to our students. She is very competent in her responsibilities and has a big sense of urgency attending with priority to our students’ needs. She is a team player and brings joy to our school and creativity, positive energy, hope, happiness and respect to our staff, students and other members of our school community. Thank you, Mrs. Patrice-Johnson… our school community feels very proud of you!”

#SCSDGivesThanks for Ms. Patrice-Johnson and our other committed social workers!

post_text: In early March, several Clary Middle School students and staff were invited to compete in the Spartan Race at Greek Peak Mountain Resort. Seventh grader Cairo Tripp and eighth grader Jai’Lynn Holloman participated in the Spartan Kids race, a two-mile obstacle course with 10-15 obstacles; and staff members Martin Pasternak, Dan Jones, Alex Rodriguez and Paul Crisafulli participated in the adult race, which was 3.5 miles with 20 obstacles. Both races were held on the ski slopes of Greek Peak, meaning that all participants had to not only handle the running and obstacles, but also very steep inclines and declines. The Clary team was able to participate for free thanks to support from The Spartan Foundation, and they competed against more than 3,700 participants from all over the country. What a fun way to challenge themselves and stay physically active! #SCSDSuccess

In this mock assembly, the students discussed five bills that affect the Latino community, including credit worthiness, teacher diversity, domestic violence registration, affirmative action and graduation measures. Check out these photos of students rehearsing in the Onondaga County Legislature... what a great experience for these students! Congratulations to Corcoran High School students Talia Plaza Negron, Teresa Plaza Negron, Ana Lucia Rodriguez and Vanessa Vergara, as well as Nottingham students Priscila Carbonel and Justo Antonio Triana. #SCSDCivicReady

Congratulations to Team 5221C (Thomas La, Aphone Paing, Connor Shanahan, Sam Livingston and Max Gingold), who were named Tournament Champions; as well as Team 5221B (Kayla Nguyen, Dakota Smith, Jesse Gallipeau, Joshua Williams, Jr. and Kara Shanahan), who won the skills competition! #SCSDSuccess

Young ladies at H.W. Smith PreK-8 School have been building their self-worth, teamwork and leadership skills – and improving the school – thanks to a Building Women group. Offered through Peaceful Schools, the group provides regular enrichment to girls in grades four through eight.

“Building Women has taught me that girls can do everything that boys can do… even if we think we can’t!” sixth grader Nadia Jackson said. “When I get older, I’ll be able to teach other women how to cooperate and work together as a team.”

Learn more about this great program:
http://www.syracusecityschools.com/districtpage.cfm?pageid=11122 #SCSDSuccess

Coming up on Thursday, February 27th: The NYS Board of Regents will create a Blue Ribbon Commission to review the State's high school graduation measures and reaffirm what it means to obtain a diploma in New York State. The Board of Regents and State Education Department are holding regional meetings to help inform the work of the Blue Ribbon Commission.

Meeting attendees will have the opportunity to break into smaller groups to discuss and provide feedback to the Department. Please come and share your input! We hope to see you on 2/27 at 5:00 pm (Snow date: Thursday, March 5, 2020) at PSLA at Fowler High School. Learn more and register by visiting: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/nys-board-of-regents-graduation-measures-regional-meeting-tickets-93105712693 #NYSGradMeasures
